steps.title: â€œTrippingâ€ means youâ€™re overreacting or acting irrationally.
steps.content: â€œTrippingâ€ means youâ€™re overreacting or acting irrationally. The slang term â€œtrippingâ€ is often used in response to something considered minor by onlookers. steps.title: â€œTrippingâ€ also means youâ€™re making a mistake or blunder.

steps.title: The slang term â€œtrippingâ€ first appeared among drug users in the 1960s.
steps.content: The slang term â€œtrippingâ€ first appeared among drug users in the 1960s. As drug slang, â€œtrippingâ€ was first used in the 1960s to refer to the effects people felt when high on hallucinogens. This meaning became more popular as hallucinogenic drugs did, particularly during the 70s. When you take hallucinogenic drugs, you often act erratically or seem detached from reality, which likely contributed to the other slang meanings used today. [2] X Research source

steps.title: â€œTrippingâ€ was used to describe crazy behaviors in the 1990s.
steps.content: â€œTrippingâ€ was used to describe crazy behaviors in the 1990s. â€œTrippingâ€ transformed into a way to describe someone whoâ€™s acting crazy or irrational around the early 1990s when Black hip-hop acts like Wu-Tang Clan, Dr. Dre, and Coolie started to use the phrase in their songs, making it an AAVE term. [3] X Research source For example, Dr. Dre used â€œtrippingâ€ as a way to say heâ€™s going crazy on the 1992 track, â€œNothinâ€™ but a G Thangâ€: â€œNever let me slip / â€˜cause if I slip, then Iâ€™m slippinâ€™ / But if I got my nina / then you know Iâ€™m straight trippinâ€™.â€ â€œSet trippinâ€™â€ is when one gang set starts a conflict with another gang set, which may involve acting crazy or irrationally.

steps.title: FAFO
steps.content: FAFO FAFO is an acronym (and a slang phrase) that stands for â€œf**k around and find out.â€ It serves as a warning to others not to mess with them, or else they may face consequences that they werenâ€™t expecting.
